intro: Gynoxys fallax, commonly known as the Mexican velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Gynoxys fallax is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage and floral display.
